citations.narrative:
On 22 June 2024, a two-month-old male otter died after being found trapped on a ramp in the holding area. The otter pup
had slipped into a gap between the ramp and the wall and was unable to free itself. A zookeeper was able to free the
trapped animal; however, despite emergency care provided by both animal care and animal health staff, the otter was
unresponsive.
Housing facilities must be designed and constructed to ensure the safety of the animals. The indoor and outdoor housing
facilities shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the
animals.
The zoo has completed modifications to the holding area for the otters.
Corrected prior to the inspection on 26 September 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On 22 June 2024, a two-month-old male otter died after being found trapped on a ramp in the holding area. The otter pup 
had slipped into a gap between the ramp and the wall and was unable to free itself. A zookeeper was able to free the 
trapped animal; however, despite emergency care provided by both animal care and animal health staff, the otter was 
unresponsive.  
 
Housing facilities must be designed and constructed to ensure the safety of the animals. The indoor and outdoor housing 
facilities shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the 
animals. 
 
The zoo has completed modifications to the holding area for the otters. 
 
Corrected prior to the inspection on 26 September 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
